victim.name: Jeremiah Morland
victim.occupation: A dedicated security officer tasked with overseeing the ancient, dimly lit stacks of the haunted library, responsible for maintaining order amid whispered legends and eerie occurrences.
victim.personality: Despite his brave posture, Jeremiah is marked by a fearful and anxious nature, constantly on edge from the ghostly tales and unexplained noises that permeate his nightly rounds.
victim.cause_of_death: Found at the foot of a rickety balcony within the library, Jeremiah met a grim end from a sudden, forceful push from a height, leaving many to question whether the spectral rumors hold some sinister truth.

profile.name: Frederick Hawthorne
profile.description: An elderly scholar obsessed with occult knowledge, known for his rigid principles about preserving the sanctity of the library and its secrets.
profile.relationship_to_victim: Library historian who often clashed with Jeremiah over access policies and handling of forbidden texts.

original_mmo.means: Frederick could have used his intimate knowledge of the library's architecture to lure Jeremiah onto the rickety balcony and then forcefully push him from the precarious height.
original_mmo.motive: Hawthorne was fiercely protective of the library's secrets and viewed Jeremiah's security measures as reckless and disrespectful, threatening to expose and mishandle forbidden occult texts that Hawthorne believed must remain concealed at all costs.
original_mmo.opportunity: As the library historian, Frederick frequently wandered the restricted sections late at night, allowing him to encounter Jeremiah alone on the dimly lit balcony where the fatal push occurred.

modified_mmo_elements.original_element_description: As the library historian, Frederick frequently wandered the restricted sections late at night, allowing him to encounter Jeremiah alone on the dimly lit balcony where the fatal push occurred.
modified_mmo_elements.modified_element_description: Although Frederick often accessed restricted sections at night, multiple staff members have confirmed he was attending a late-night archival meeting in the main hall at the time Jeremiah was pushed from the balcony, preventing him from being near the scene.
modified_mmo_elements.reason_for_modification: The verified presence at a meeting provides Frederick with a solid alibi, removing his opportunity to confront Jeremiah on the balcony.

profile.name: Rosalind Tremblay
profile.description: A cunning archivist desperate to secure a rare manuscript rumored to be worth a fortune, willing to cross moral boundaries to achieve her goals.
profile.relationship_to_victim: Colleague and rival at the library, aspiring to gain control over the most valuable collections.

original_mmo.means: Rosalind used her intimate knowledge of the library's layout and maintenance schedules to access the rickety balcony unnoticed. Taking advantage of the victim's anxious nature, she stealthily pushed Jeremiah from the balcony during his nightly rounds, ensuring the fall appeared accidental amid the library's shadowy ambiance.
original_mmo.motive: Driven by ambition and greed, Rosalind sought to claim the rare manuscript valued greatly among collectors. Jeremiah's diligent patrols and control over access thwarted her plans, prompting her to eliminate the obstacle to secure the prized collection and advance her standing within the library.
original_mmo.opportunity: As a colleague routinely working late hours in the library archives, Rosalind shared overlapping shifts with Jeremiah, providing her the chance to confront him on the dimly lit balcony during his vulnerable, solitary patrol of the haunted stacks.

modified_mmo_elements.original_element_description: As a colleague routinely working late hours in the library archives, Rosalind shared overlapping shifts with Jeremiah, providing her the chance to confront him on the dimly lit balcony during his vulnerable, solitary patrol of the haunted stacks.
modified_mmo_elements.modified_element_description: Although Rosalind worked late hours, security logs and CCTV footage confirm that she was accounted for in the main reading hall at the estimated time of the murder, making her presence on the balcony impossible.
modified_mmo_elements.reason_for_modification: The security logs and footage provide an alibi eliminating her opportunity to commit the murder on the balcony.

profile.name: Gideon Fairchild
profile.description: A trusted friend and fellow security officer, troubled by Jeremiah's deteriorating mental state and haunted by fear that led him to take drastic measures.
profile.relationship_to_victim: Fellow security officer and close companion during nightly patrols.

original_mmo.means: Gideon could have used his physical strength during a tense confrontation on the precarious balcony, shoving Jeremiah over the edge in a moment of impulsive action.
original_mmo.motive: Seeing Jeremiah's mental state deteriorate due to his overwhelming fear and anxiety in the haunted library, Gideon believed ending his suffering was an act of mercy to spare him further torment.
original_mmo.opportunity: As fellow security officers patrolling the library together, Gideon had access to the balcony during their nightly rounds and could isolate Jeremiah at a vulnerable moment to commit the act.

evidence_items.description: A torn fragment of a map detailing the library's architecture with notes in Frederick Hawthorne's handwriting was found near the security officer's base, showing precise routes and highlighting the rickety balcony area.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: This map fragment suggests Frederick’s detailed knowledge of the library layout could enable him to reach the balcony where Jeremiah was pushed.

evidence_items.description: Several staff recalled Frederick vehemently arguing with Jeremiah about the handling of the occult texts days before the incident, accusing him of reckless security measures.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: These disputes highlight Frederick’s strong motive rooted in protecting the library’s secrets from what he perceived as Jeremiah's carelessness.

evidence_items.description: An old maintenance schedule found in Rosalind Tremblay's desk reveals detailed notes about quiet times in the library, indicating she knew exactly when staff movements were minimal.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: Her knowledge of maintenance and quiet hours suggests she could access restricted areas unnoticed, supporting the original means theory.

evidence_items.description: Witnesses recall Rosalind expressing intense frustration over Jeremiah Morland's strict control of rare manuscripts and his refusal to grant her access to certain collections.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: These statements point to a strong motive related to ambition and greed for valuable manuscripts despite opportunity being disproven.

evidence_items.description: A smudged fingerprint matching Gideon's was found on the balcony railing beside where Jeremiah fell, suggesting direct physical involvement at the crime scene.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: The fingerprint indicates Gideon was physically present and capable of pushing Jeremiah off the balcony, supporting the means element.

evidence_items.description: Witnesses recall hearing an angry exchange between Gideon and Jeremiah shortly before the fatal fall, with Gideon expressing frustration over Jeremiah's visible mental distress.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: The confrontation highlights Gideon's motive, believing he was ending Jeremiah's suffering due to his mental anguish.

evidence_items.description: Gideon's security log shows a gap in his patrol as he accessed the balcony alone around the time Jeremiah fell, providing opportunity to isolate him.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: The log gap and solo balcony access establish Gideon had the opportunity to commit the act unnoticed.
